meanings.definition: To make a soft, low whinnying sound, as a horse.
meanings.sent1: The horse nickered softly when it saw its favorite rider.
meanings.sent2: The mare nickered happily as she trotted towards the stable.
meanings.sent3: The horse nickered playfully, trying to get the attention of the other animals.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the horse nickered a lullaby to the peaceful farm.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the horse nickered echoed through the quiet countryside.

meanings.definition: A soft, low whinnying sound, as a horse.
meanings.sent1: The gentle nickered of the horse was a soothing melody in the barn.
meanings.sent2: I woke up to the familiar nickered of our horse in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The nickered of the horse made the children giggle with delight.
meanings.sent4: In the distance, the nickered of the horse sounded like a secret code.
meanings.sent5: The nickered of the horse carried a message of peace and contentment.
